+        private void OnTypePasswordClicked(object sender, EventArgs e)
+        {
+            var node = _connectionTree.SelectedNode;
+            if (node == null) return;
+
+            if (node.OpenConnections.Count > 0)
+            {
+                var protocol = node.OpenConnections[0];
+                if (protocol != null && protocol.InterfaceControl != null)

+                    protocol.InterfaceControl.Focus();
+                    string password = node.Password;
+                    if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(password))
+                    {
+                        string escapedPassword = EscapeForSendKeys(password);
+                        SendKeys.SendWait(escapedPassword);
+                    }
+                }
+            }
+        }
+
+        private void OnTypeClipboardClicked(object sender, EventArgs e)
+        {
+            var node = _connectionTree.SelectedNode;
+            if (node == null) return;
+
+            if (node.OpenConnections.Count > 0)
+            {
+                var protocol = node.OpenConnections[0];
+                if (protocol != null && protocol.InterfaceControl != null)
+                {
+                    protocol.InterfaceControl.Focus();
+                    if (Clipboard.ContainsText())
+                    {
+                        string text = Clipboard.GetText();
+                        string escapedText = EscapeForSendKeys(text);
+                        SendKeys.SendWait(escapedText);
+                    }
+                }
+            }
+        }
+
+        private string EscapeForSendKeys(string str)
+        {
+            System.Text.StringBuilder sb = new System.Text.StringBuilder();
+            foreach (char c in str)
+            {
+                if (c == '+' || c == '^' || c == '%' || c == '~' || c == '(' || c == ')' || c == '{' || c == '}' || c == '[' || c == ']')
+                {
+                    sb.Append("{");
+                    sb.Append(c);
+                    sb.Append("}");
+                }
+                else
+                {
+                    sb.Append(c);
+                }
+            }
+            return sb.ToString();
+        }
+
         #endregion
     }
 }

--- a/mRemoteNGDocumentation/folders_and_inheritance.rst
+++ b/mRemoteNGDocumentation/folders_and_inheritance.rst
@@ -58,6 +58,44 @@ everything else will be inherited from the parent folder.
 Of course you can also only let some of the properties be inherited.
 Just play around with this a bit and you'll get the hang of it.
 
+Default Connection Properties
+=============================
+You can define default values for almost any property. These default values will be used
+when you create a new connection. This saves you from entering the same information repeatedly.
+
+To configure the Default Connection Properties:
+
+1. Look at the **Config** panel (usually in the bottom-left corner).
+2. Click the **Default Properties** icon (hover to see the tooltip "Default Properties").
+3. The panel will switch to show the default properties.
+4. Enter your desired default values (e.g., Username, Domain, Protocol).
+
+Now, whenever you create a new connection, it will start with these values.
+These defaults are also applied when opening a URL via the Quick Connect bar
+or when importing connections that do not specify their own values.
+
+Default Inheritance
+===================
+Similar to Default Properties, you can also define which properties should be inherited by default.
+This is useful if you almost always want connections to inherit certain settings (like Credentials)
+from their parent folder.
+
+To configure Default Inheritance:
+
+1. In the **Config** panel, click the **Default Inheritance** icon (hover to see the tooltip "Default Inheritance").
+2. Set the properties to **Yes** (Inherit) or **No** (Do not inherit).
+
+When you create a new connection, its inheritance settings will match what you configured here.
+
+Applying Defaults to Existing Connections
+=========================================
+If you have changed the inheritance settings of a connection and want to reset them to your global defaults:
+
+1. Right-click on the connection or folder in the **Connections** tree.
+2. Select :menuselection:`Inheritance --> Apply default inheritance`.
+
+This will update the selected item's inheritance settings to match the global Default Inheritance configuration.
+
 Color Property
 ==============
 You can set a color for each connection or folder in the connections list.
